item.title: Malcolm Hicks, Corporate Vice President of McDonald’s Europe and General Counsel
item.description:
On October 23, 2015, I receive an email from Malcolm Hicks who is the Corporate Vice President of McDonald’s Europe.

FROM: Malcolm.Hicks@eu.mcd.com

To: [Victim/key witness/whistleblower’s name, redacted for privacy] (Visit X-v-France.com for more information on who I am.)

SUBJECT: France Monopoly Game Query

Date: October 23, 2015 at 05:34 +0800

item.title: Additional frauds; email sent to McDonald’s General Counsel CCed to McDonald’s CEO
item.description: From: [Victim/key witness/whistleblower’s name, redacted for privacy] (Visit X-v-France.com for more information on who I am.) TO : Gloria.Santona@us.mcd.com CC : Steve.Easterbrook@us.mcd.com SUBJECT: additional frauds Ms Santona, Thank you for answering me. Could you please make sure the French team communicate with me by email? Normal mail takes forever for me to receive now that I live in China and I am not going to wait one month to act if there is an ongoing fraud.

item.title: Email sent to Gloria Santona, General Counsel of McDonald’s Corporation, requesting an update
item.description: Ms. Santona, I would like to give a friendly reminder that I gave McDonald’s a deadline of October 22nd 2015 midnight GMT time. So you have about 36 hours left. It was 4 entire days which is more than enough considering I’ve sent my first cease and desist letter back in 2012. On top of this, had I known that the French branch had started scamming people again, I would have at the time only given you 24 to 48 hours.

item.title: Warning sent to McDonald’s executives about being an accessory after the fact
item.description: From: [Victim/key witness/whistleblower’s name, redacted for privacy] (Visit X-v-France.com for more information on who I am.) Subject: Accessory after the facts Date sent:: October 21, 2015 at 12:33 (Beijing time +0800) To:: Gloria.Santona@us.mcd.com Cc:: Steve.Easterbrook@us.mcd.com, Robert.Gibbs@us.mcd.com, Silvia.Lagnado@us.mcd.com, Kevin.Ozan@us.mcd.com, Jim.Sappington@us.mcd.com, Mike.Andres@us.mcd.com, Nawfal.TRABELSI@fr.mcd.com, Isabelle.KUSTER@fr.mcd.com, Alexis.BOURDON@fr.mcd.com, Hubert.MONGON@fr.mcd.com, Christophe.CHAPUIS@fr.mcd.com, Xavier.ROYAUX@fr.mcd.com, Francoise.deBorda@fr.mcd.com Dear Ms. Santona, I am surprised that the French website carrying the fraud hasn’t been taken down yet. I do believe that the U.S. executive team can legally be held responsible and be accessory after the facts for this massive fraud.

item.title: Fraud of the century: emails to McDonald’s executives
item.description: From: [Victim/key witness/whistleblower’s name, redacted for privacy] (Visit X-v-France.com for more information on who I am.) SUBJECT: Fraud of the century DATE: October 20, 2015 at 03:13 (Beijing time +0800) TO: Gloria SANTONA CC: Steve EASTERBROOK, Robert.Gibbs@us.mcd.com, Silvia.Lagnado@us.mcd.com, Kevin.Ozan@us.mcd.com, Jim.Sappington@us.mcd.com, Mike.Andres@us.mcd.com Ms. Santona, First of all, I want to thank you for having taken my phone call today without hanging up on me right away. Your counter-part in France, Mme de Borda, always refused to communicate with me through phone.
